Author: xStingx
Text: I do this too. The only thing that stops me is knowing that my morning weight will be my true weight. Nothing in between matters. Doesn't matter if I went up a pound or went down a pound. Nothing counts until I wake up from sleeping and step on.

Author: noonelovesacowgirl
Text: Not sure if this helps, but maybe keep in mind that you lose most weight while you sleep. Getting 8+ consecutive hours of sleep is really crucial *and* it means you'll be at your lowest when you wake up in the morning. Those extra few hours can mean the number is closer to your "true" (non-water retaining) weight than what it would be at 1am.
